title: Phase 3: Time Tracking
description:
Track time spent on meetings, breaks, and optionally tasks. Calculate daily time summaries.

**Requires Phase 2**: Uses task infrastructure for task-level time tracking.

**Time Entry Formats** (in log):
```
- 10:30 [meeting:standup] 30m       # meeting with duration
- 12:00 [break] 45m                  # break with duration
- 14:00 [task:abc123] Started work   # task entry (duration calculated from next entry or end of day)
```

**Features to Implement**:

1. **Duration Parsing**
   - Extend log entry parser to extract Xm or Xh duration
   - Store in duration_minutes field

2. **Time Calculation Service** (internal/time/)
   - CalculateDaySummary(date): aggregate time by category
   - For tasks without explicit duration, calculate from timestamps
   - Categories: meetings, breaks, tasks (by task), untracked

3. **Daily Summary Component** (internal/tui/components/summary.go)
   - Shows time breakdown at bottom of journal view
   - Toggle with 's' key
   - Format: "Meetings: 1h30m | Tasks: 4h15m | Breaks: 45m | Untracked: 1h30m"

4. **Optional Start/Stop Timer**
   - rk start <task-id> - log "Started work on [task]"
   - rk stop - log "Stopped" (duration auto-calculated)
   - TUI: Ctrl+S to start/stop timer on current task

5. **CLI Commands**:
   - rk summary - output today's time breakdown
   - rk summary --week - output week's time breakdown
   - rk start <task-id> - start timer on task
   - rk stop - stop current timer

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Log entries with 30m duration are parsed and stored
- [meeting:name] Xm entries are categorized as meetings
- [break] Xm entries are categorized as breaks
- rk summary outputs time breakdown for today
- TUI shows time summary (toggle with 's')
- Task time calculated from log entry timestamps
- Start/stop timer commands work

title: Phase 4: Zettelkasten Notes
description:
Implement a knowledge base with searchable notes. Notes use wiki-style [[slug]] links and support full-text search via SQLite FTS5.

**Requires Phase 1**: Uses parser, storage infrastructure. Independent of tasks.

**Note File Format** (notes/<slug>.md):
```markdown
---
title: Git interactive rebase workflow
created: 2025-01-12
tags: [git, workflow]
---

To squash the last 3 commits:
    git rebase -i HEAD~3

Change 'pick' to 'squash' for commits to combine.

## See Also
- [[git-bisect-workflow]]
- [[git-cherry-pick]]
```

**SQLite Additions**:
```sql
CREATE TABLE notes (slug TEXT PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, created TEXT, file_path TEXT);
CREATE TABLE note_tags (slug TEXT, tag TEXT, PRIMARY KEY (slug, tag));
CREATE VIRTUAL TABLE notes_fts USING fts5(slug, title, content, tags);
```

**Features to Implement**:

1. **Note Domain Model** (internal/note/)
   - Note struct: slug, title, created, tags, content, links (extracted [[slug]] refs)
   - NoteService: Create, GetBySlug, Search, ListByTag, ListAll

2. **Note Parser/Writer** (internal/parser/)
   - Parse frontmatter (title, created, tags)
   - Extract [[slug]] links from content
   - Slug generation from title (lowercase, hyphenated)

3. **FTS5 Indexing** (internal/storage/)
   - Index note content in FTS5 table on save/rebuild
   - Search returns ranked results

4. **Note Search Component** (internal/tui/components/note_search.go)
   - Text input for search query
   - Results list with title and snippet
   - Enter to view note

5. **Note View Component** (internal/tui/components/note_view.go)
   - Display note content (markdown rendered or plain)
   - [[slug]] links are navigable (Enter to follow)
   - 'e' to edit in $EDITOR

6. **Tag Browser** (internal/tui/components/tag_browser.go)
   - List all tags with note counts
   - Select tag to filter notes

7. **Note Creation Flow**
   - TUI: Ctrl+N in notes mode opens creation form
   - CLI: rk note new "title" creates note, opens in $EDITOR

8. **TUI Integration**
   - New mode: Notes (switch with Ctrl+K or 'n' from main view)
   - Notes mode shows: search bar, tag filter, note list, note preview

9. **CLI Commands**:
   - rk note new "title" - create note, output path, open in $EDITOR
   - rk note search "query" - full-text search, output matching notes
   - rk note list - list all notes (--tag filter)
   - rk note show <slug> - output note content

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Can create notes from TUI and CLI
- Notes are stored as markdown in ~/.reckon/notes/<slug>.md
- rk note search "query" returns FTS5 results
- TUI has notes mode with search, tag filter, note list
- [[slug]] links are detected and navigable in TUI
- Tags are indexed and browsable
- rk rebuild includes notes in FTS5 index

title: Phase 5: Periodic Review
description:
Surface stale tasks and prompt the user to triage them. Helps maintain a clean task list and prevents tasks from being forgotten.

**Requires Phase 2**: Uses task infrastructure to query stale tasks.

**Features to Implement**:

1. **Stale Task Query** (internal/task/)
   - FindStaleTasks(days int): tasks with no log entries in N days
   - Default: 7 days for active, 30 days for waiting
   - Exclude 'someday' tasks from stale detection

2. **Review TUI Mode** (internal/tui/components/review.go)
   - List of stale tasks with last activity date
   - For each task, quick actions:
     - 'd' - mark done
     - 's' - move to someday
     - 'w' - mark waiting (prompts for reason)
     - 'n' - add note/update
     - 'x' - delete task
     - Space - skip to next
   - Batch mode: review all stale tasks in sequence

3. **Weekly Review Prompt**
   - Track last_review_date in config/db
   - On first launch of the week (Monday), show prompt: "You have X stale tasks. Review now? (y/n)"
   - 'y' enters review mode, 'n' dismisses until next week

4. **Review Summary**
   - After review session, show summary: "Reviewed X tasks: Y done, Z deferred, W deleted"

5. **CLI Commands**:
   - rk review - launch review mode (or output stale tasks if not TTY)
   - rk review --list - just list stale tasks without interactive mode

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- rk review shows tasks with no activity in 7+ days
- Can mark tasks done/waiting/someday from review mode
- Can delete tasks from review mode
- Weekly prompt appears on first Monday launch
- Review summary shows what was triaged
- rk review --list outputs stale tasks for scripting

title: Phase 2: Task Management
description:
Add multi-day task tracking. Tasks are separate markdown files with their own log history. Log entries can be linked to tasks and appear in both the task file and daily journal.

**Requires Phase 1**: Uses parser, storage, and TUI infrastructure from Phase 1.

**Task File Format** (tasks/<id>.md):
```markdown
---
id: abc123
title: API refactor for v2 endpoints
created: 2025-01-10
status: active
tags: [backend, api]
---

## Description
Refactor the v2 endpoints to use the new middleware pattern.

## Log

### 2025-01-10
- 14:00 Created task, outlined approach

### 2025-01-14
- 09:00 Resumed work
```

**Task Statuses**: active, done, waiting, someday

**SQLite Additions**:
```sql
CREATE TABLE tasks (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, title TEXT, status TEXT, created TEXT, file_path TEXT);
CREATE TABLE task_tags (task_id TEXT, tag TEXT, PRIMARY KEY (task_id, tag));
CREATE TABLE task_log_entries (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, task_id TEXT, date TEXT, timestamp TEXT, content TEXT);
```

**Features to Implement**:

1. **Task Domain Model** (internal/task/)
   - Task struct with id, title, status, created, tags, description, log entries
   - TaskService: Create, GetByID, List (filter by status/tags), UpdateStatus, AppendLog

2. **Task Parser/Writer** (internal/parser/)
   - Parse task frontmatter (id, title, created, status, tags array)
   - Parse description section
   - Parse log section (grouped by date)

3. **Dual-Write Logic**
   - When logging to a task, entry goes to BOTH:
     - Task file under appropriate date header
     - Daily journal with [task:id] prefix
   - TaskService coordinates this

4. **Task Picker Component** (internal/tui/components/task_picker.go)
   - Fuzzy-searchable list of active tasks
   - Used when starting work on a task or logging to specific task

5. **Two-Pane TUI Layout**
   - Left pane: daily journal (existing)
   - Right pane: current task (when selected)
   - Tab switches between panes
   - Ctrl+T opens task picker

6. **Task Creation Flow**
   - From TUI: Ctrl+N opens task creation form (title, tags)
   - From CLI: rk task new "title" --tags=backend,api
   - Can also promote an intention to a task

7. **CLI Commands**:
   - rk task new "title" - create task, outputs task ID
   - rk task list - list active tasks (--status, --tag filters)
   - rk task show <id> - output task details
   - rk task log <id> "msg" - append to task log (also adds to today's journal)
   - rk task done <id> - mark task complete

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Can create tasks from TUI and CLI
- Task picker allows fuzzy search of active tasks
- Two-pane view shows journal and current task
- Logging to task writes to both task file and daily journal
- rk task list shows active tasks
- rk task log <id> "msg" works from CLI
- Task status transitions work (active â†’ done/waiting/someday)
- Can filter tasks by tag

title: TUI: Inconsistent error handling in date navigation

title: Phase 1: Daily Journal MVP
description:
Implement the core daily journaling system - the foundation of Reckon. This creates a TUI for viewing/editing daily journals and CLI commands for scripting.

**Storage Model**:
- Data directory: ~/.reckon/
- Journal files: ~/.reckon/journal/YYYY-MM-DD.md
- SQLite index: ~/.reckon/reckon.db
- Markdown is source of truth; SQLite is rebuildable via rk rebuild

**Journal File Format** (journal/2025-01-15.md):
```markdown
---
date: 2025-01-15
---

## Intentions
- [ ] Open task (unchecked)
- [x] Completed task (checked)
- [>] Carried from previous day

## Wins
- Something accomplished

## Log
- 09:00 Started day
- 10:30 [meeting:standup] 30m
- 14:00 [task:abc123] Working on feature
```

**SQLite Schema**:
```sql
CREATE TABLE journals (date TEXT PRIMARY KEY, file_path TEXT, last_modified INTEGER);
CREATE TABLE intentions (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, journal_date TEXT, text TEXT, status TEXT, carried_from TEXT, position INTEGER);
CREATE TABLE log_entries (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, journal_date TEXT, timestamp TEXT, content TEXT, task_id TEXT, entry_type TEXT, duration_minutes INTEGER, position INTEGER);
CREATE TABLE wins (id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, journal_date TEXT, text TEXT, position INTEGER);
```

**Features to Implement**:

1. **Project Setup**
   - Initialize Go module, create directory structure per plan
   - Dependencies: bubbletea, lipgloss, bubbles, cobra, goldmark, fsnotify, xid, modernc.org/sqlite

2. **Config & Paths** (internal/config/)
   - DataDir(), JournalDir(), DatabasePath() helpers
   - Auto-create directories on first run

3. **Domain Models** (internal/journal/)
   - Journal, Intention (open/done/carried), LogEntry (log/meeting/break), Win
   - ID generation using xid

4. **Markdown Parser** (internal/parser/)
   - Parse YAML frontmatter (date)
   - Parse sections by H2 headers (Intentions, Wins, Log)
   - Parse intention markers: [ ], [x], [>]
   - Parse log entries: timestamp, optional [meeting:name], [task:id], duration 30m

5. **Markdown Writer** (internal/parser/)
   - Serialize Journal back to markdown format
   - Round-trip must preserve content

6. **Storage Layer** (internal/storage/)
   - Filesystem: read/write markdown files
   - SQLite: connection with WAL mode, migrations, repository pattern

7. **Journal Service** (internal/journal/service.go)
   - GetToday(), GetByDate(date), AppendLog(content), AddIntention(text), ToggleIntention(id), AddWin(text)
   - Dual-write: update markdown file AND SQLite
   - Auto-carry: when opening a new day, copy open intentions from yesterday as [>]

8. **CLI Commands** (internal/cli/)
   - rk log "msg" - append timestamped entry to today's log
   - rk today - output today's journal to stdout (for LLM piping)
   - rk week - output last 7 days to stdout
   - rk rebuild - delete and regenerate SQLite from all markdown files

9. **TUI** (internal/tui/)
   - Main model with state: currentDate, currentJournal, focusedSection
   - Components: IntentionList (navigable, Enter to toggle), WinsView, LogView, LogInput (text input)
   - Statusbar with keybinding hints
   - Key bindings: Tab (cycle sections), i (add intention), l (add log), w (add win), h/Left (prev day), l/Right (next day, max today), t (jump to today), ? (help), q (quit)
   - Past days are read-only (no editing)

10. **File Watcher** (internal/sync/)
    - Watch ~/.reckon/journal/ for external changes
    - Debounce 100ms, re-index changed files to SQLite
    - Notify TUI to reload if current journal changed

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- rk launches TUI showing today's journal (creates empty if none exists)
- Can navigate sections with Tab, add intentions with 'i', log entries with 'l', wins with 'w'
- Can toggle intentions done with Enter
- Can navigate to previous days with h/l (read-only)
- rk log "test" appends to today's journal from CLI
- rk today outputs journal content to stdout
- rk rebuild regenerates SQLite from markdown files
- External file edits are detected and TUI refreshes
- Opening a new day auto-carries open intentions with [>] marker

**Key Files**:
- cmd/rk/main.go - entry point
- internal/journal/service.go - core business logic
- internal/parser/journal_parser.go - markdown parsing
- internal/tui/model.go - TUI state management
